title: Time to stop pretending Senna is balanced?
body:
She's one of the highest pick rate supports and has a great win rate

As well as a good ADC pick rate, with a very high win rate

She was out for a patch and became one of the best champions for 2 roles, and she still does ok at top as well

People keep trying to say how well balanced she is, but you think she wouldn't be borderline pick/ban already if she's so balanced

replies.body:
I don't think her sup win rate is quite as high as you think?
I just checked leagueofgraphs and her support winrate Is 51.6%, her adc winrate Is 54.6%. 
The adc winrate is a tad high, but less people play her adc apparently. If anything, her numbers could probably get tuned down a bit, but I think Senna is pretty okay currently. But, I also like playing her, so take that with a grain of salt.

It's not so much the fact she has a 51.6%

It's the fact she's new and is the 2nd highest pick rate as well, so that's pretty high considering the situation

And typically when a champ is new that means people are still figuring them out. Remember Yuumi everyone? Super low winrate at first and then it started getting out of control. Rito will probably nerf her once the True Damage hype wears off though.

This is statistically one of the highest win rates ever seen on a new champion. Shes overperforming in a meta that shouldn't be favoring her. Its very clearly overtuned why on earth are people defending this.

> [{quoted}](name=i4got2pull0ut,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GoAkMA7P,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-27T00:08:41.355+0000)
>
> This is statistically one of the highest win rates ever seen on a new champion. Shes overperforming in a meta that shouldn't be favoring her. Its very clearly overtuned why on earth are people defending this.

Except she's in a meta that favors her. She can actually deal damage to the top tanks right now and has sufficient peel for the 1 shot meta. Is she overtuned? Yup. She has to be to compete with the other overtuned supports like Naut/Leona who become invincible level 3. I'm all for nerfing her, if we also nerf the others.

I'm not sure where this argument of "she's preforming well in a meta she shouldn't be preforming well in" came from. If she's doing well in the current meta, then she is "supposed" to be preforming well in that meta. It's like saying Morgana shouldn't be preforming in this meta because she's not doing what the other engage supports are doing. She's meta precisely because she counters the meta, just like Senna.

Well, doesn't it make sense that new champs have high pick rates after release? Everyone wants to try out the champion. 
Though it is seeming like Senna will remain fairly popular after the hype has died down, I don't think she's going to stay the 2nd highest pick rate.

You missed the entire point. A good/high win rate combined with a high pick rate is what proves her strength. When a huge part of the community can play her so successfully after just being released, it's clearly over-tuned.

Its a really simple kit? 

Yea lots of words but in game its really simple.

 Collect stacks via being in lane and by 2 hit combos.
Q anything, Team for heal enemy for damage.
W some one to CC.
E for MS to engage or escape.
R to shield or snipe.

The most difficult part of her kit to land is W. 

Yes, There is mechanically some things to learn on her, but the floor is pretty dam low here.

A simple kit yes, like every other adc and pretty much every support. So why is it that she has the best stats? Popularity can be explained by being new but the combination of popularity and win rate can't.

She does not have the best stats?

Her Pick rate and Ban rate are high due to being the new release. This is normal
But she's not leading the pack?  Not #1 in anything for in game stats far as I see. Not #1 in WR for any role far as I see.

Its not very shocking a simple kit is easy to pick up.  You have played her, I felt like it took about 2-3 games to really get a feel for her kit.  Doubt Most players would really need more then 5 unless they lack basic mechanics.

That's not a hard Floor to break into.

Whats the most complex thing to learn about her. That Q resets auto attacks and can be cast onto any target including towers and wards?

That W will instantly trigger if it kills a minion?

What is it exactly you think exists In her kit that would require players to spend time mastering for her to be viable?
What's needed beyond a basic understanding of her kit for her to be helpful? 

Again, shes got a lot of text but she is a simple champion.  I expect the same thing for most simple kits, Her WR will start to drop once players are willing to intentionally counter pick her.

Why do you keep talking about the mastery of her kit like anyone would have mentioned it but you? You are avoiding the point.

>But she's not leading the pack? Not #1 in anything for in game stats far as I see. Not #1 in WR for any role far as I see.

You didn't look very well then.

https://u.gg/lol/champions/senna/build?role=adc

She has the highest win rate out of all adcs and her 5.4% pick rate is large enough that it means a lot. She is rated in the S+ tier.

She has too high win rate for a champion that easy and that big play rate, in both support and adc roles.

> [{quoted}](name=Jimmy Rustles,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GoAkMA7P,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2019-11-26T18:53:57.876+0000)
>
> It's not so much the fact she has a 51.6%
> 
> It's the fact she's new and is the 2nd highest pick rate as well, so that's pretty high considering the situation

Thresh is a higher pick rate but only because he has a 10% ban rate and Senna is at 60%. 

Senna has a 60-70% pick rate when not banned. That's actually just insane.

Regardless if you want to argue whether or not a 51% WR on a support is healthy or not, she is still sporting 60% ban rate. 

Thats enough to get a nerf.
She has a high ban rate because shes a new champion noone wants to learn to play against. She has some really bad weaknesses
Weaknesses?  Uh....what?
....Engage supports ala Naut, Blitz, and Leona? Do you people even play this game?

Lol I've beaten her every game as blitz her auto attacks put her in a mini snare to where she cant move for after she grabs a soul for a second so if you see her walk towards a soul you can kill her pretty easily. Shes also weak to anyone with dashes because she doesn't have an escape
Let's leave out the people who are stupid and get grabbed. It's like saying that "guys, I hooked a Draven as he was going to catch an axe".

Yeah but human error is part of the games balance think of the 10/0 yas that hints because he tries to 1v5. Honestly senna has some really bad matchups that's just facts. But the matchups where shes even or wins she will out perform

> [{quoted}](name=Lewd Neeko,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GoAkMA7P,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-11-26T18:42:34.569+0000)
>
> I don't think her sup win rate is quite as high as you think?
> I just checked leagueofgraphs and her support winrate Is 51.6%, her adc winrate Is 54.6%. 
> The adc winrate is a tad high, but less people play her adc apparently. If anything, her numbers could probably get tuned down a bit, but I think Senna is pretty okay currently. But, I also like playing her, so take that with a grain of salt.

She is 90% presence in Master tier with 55% win rates as a 3 role champ that people are still learning how to play. She is easily the most broken champ in the game since S3 Kass
Anything above 51%, especially if it has a high pick rate, is nerf worthy.
Nerf the numbers, but leave the kit alone IMO. I've only played her a couple of times but she was quite fun.

Oh yea, I don't want to see any major changes to her kit

The biggest change would be putting some restrictions on her Q targets, mainly allied minions since that results in some insanely safe Q poke

Honestly they need to reduce the range of her Q and have it go up with every point put into it back to it's original height. That and reduce the amount of souls you can get some auto attacking someone over and over.

before even touching senna they need to address support items first... 

She does well because shes constantly genertaing gold thanks to her passive souls giving gold and so is outperforming

>before even touching senna they need to address support items first...

No they don't, the items are fine outside of maybe tank supports needing better stat combination than hp+ap. Everything else is just fine. Supports are not weak which means the items don't need work.

> [{quoted}](name=GonahtanuGepardi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GoAkMA7P,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2019-11-26T19:54:06.584+0000)
>
> No they don't, the items are fine outside of maybe tank supports needing better stat combination than hp+ap. Everything else is just fine. Supports are not weak which means the items don't need work.

Hahahahahahahaha

As a support main this pains me. Support items are terrible right now. After mid game you generate 0 gold. This is why Pyke, Senna and Engage Tanks are dominating right now. (Pyke gains gold, Senna gets passive. Tanks like Leona, Blitz, and Nautilus don’t need many items to be useful) pretty much every other support is struggling because they can’t gain any income. Mage Supports are now useless because items are way too expensive for them. After your item completes, you only gain gold from team fights and killing wards really. And as your realistically only getting assists on kills that’s around 30-150 gold per assist and 10-30 gold per ward. All your passive gold income from support item should go into buying control wards. (Assuming you’re buying 1-2 control wards every back)

The New Support items although a nice change have never been in a worse spot: (Income Wise)

>Hahahahahahahaha

This tells nothing intelligent is coming.

>As a support main this pains me. Support items are terrible right now.

And you are saying that because you are a support main and because you are a support main, you most likely do not understand the game. The items are far from terrible. You are comparing them to the old, overpowered support items so ofc they look weaker because they are. they are supposed to be. Look at the supports now, are they bad? No. It would be absurd to even attempt to claim something like that, which means there is no problem.

>After mid game you generate 0 gold.

You do generate gold. Exaggerating isn't going to do you any good. However, the amount you generate is like it should be. Support is a role that was created for the sole purpose of giving away their resources for another teammate, not to start pulling out resources out of their own asses. Over the years, the support role has gained more and more power, not because they were weak or needed it, but because riot wanted to make the role more popular and it became overpowered. The role doesn't need gold to be viable. More gold means more items which also means more damage. Supports are supposed to support, not to be the main carry. Carry other to carry you. That's what support is supposed to be, just like the jungler.

>This is why Pyke, Senna and Engage Tanks are dominating right now.

Pyke and senna and engage supports were already dominating before the changes so this point is invalid. Engage champions have been strong for a long time now because currently the team or a champion that engages first is 90% of the time the winner.

> pretty much every other support is struggling because they can’t gain any income.

Not the reason.

> Mage Supports are now useless because items are way too expensive for them.

Good. Also brand and vel'koz are still fine. Mages aren't supposed to be supports anyway. you could say that it's my personal opinion but i'm looking at it from a perspective of what the support role was intended for - giving up resources for others. And i'm sure riot can buff certain mage supports like zyra if they completely fall out of the game by touching their stats and not gold items.

>After your item completes, you only gain gold from team fights and killing wards really.

Which is how it should be.

>The New Support items although a nice change have never been in a worse spot: (Income Wise)

Well i never claimed otherwise, but it is still a good change and going into the right direction. The support items were added back in season 4 and supports and their items have only seen buffs until now. It's called power creep and i'm glad it's being addressed.

> [{quoted}](name=GonahtanuGepardi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GoAkMA7P,comment-id=0006000000000000,timestamp=2019-11-26T21:13:43.216+0000)
>
> This tells nothing intelligent is coming.
> 
> And you are saying that because you are a support main and because you are a support main, you most likely do not understand the game. The items are far from terrible. You are comparing them to the old, overpowered support items so ofc they look weaker because they are. they are supposed to be. Look at the supports now, are they bad? No. It would be absurd to even attempt to claim something like that, which means there is no problem.
> 
> You do generate gold. Exaggerating isn't going to do you any good. However, the amount you generate is like it should be. Support is a role that was created for the sole purpose of giving away their resources for another teammate, not to start pulling out resources out of their own asses. Over the years, the support role has gained more and more power, not because they were weak or needed it, but because riot wanted to make the role more popular and it became overpowered. The role doesn't need gold to be viable. More gold means more items which also means more damage. Supports are supposed to support, not to be the main carry. Carry other to carry you. That's what support is supposed to be, just like the jungler.
> 
> Pyke and senna and engage supports were already dominating before the changes so this point is invalid. Engage champions have been strong for a long time now because currently the team or a champion that engages first is 90% of the time the winner.
> 
> Not the reason.
> 
> Good. Also brand and vel'koz are still fine. Mages aren't supposed to be supports anyway. you could say that it's my personal opinion but i'm looking at it from a perspective of what the support role was intended for - giving up resources for others. And i'm sure riot can buff certain mage supports like zyra if they completely fall out of the game by touching their stats and not gold items.
> 
> Which is how it should be.
> 
> Well i never claimed otherwise, but it is still a good change and going into the right direction. The support items were added back in season 4 and supports and their items have only seen buffs until now. It's called power creep and i'm glad it's being addressed.

You talk a lot about "how support was meant to be".... correct me if I'm wrong but I don't believe you own league of legends? I mean you don't make the updates you don't create new champions... Essentially the only thing you do for this game from the looks of it is come here and try to tell people what's what from your own beliefs. But regardless I don't SEE anywhere that defines what a support SHOULD be? So if riot wanted supports to be able to actually have a build then who are you to stop them? You seem extremely biased into hating the support role but yet I bet a good support is the exact reason you feel good when you play the game and think you're "carrying" and get a lot of kills, but how many kills less would you be if the support didn't  set them up for you through the use of vision and well timed shields/cc. Besides it is extremely ignorant to say that a role that you don't like should be blatantly deprived of income. What about solo queue for someone who likes playing support? Are they just supposed to be thousands of gold behind because according to you they should "give their resources to others." Really? I should give resources to my random mid yasuo who is 0/6? Or my jungler who has attempted to tower the enemies in my lane and died 3-4 times? The reason supports NEED to have an income that is roughly similar to a laner is so that the whole game isn't down to "does this other player on my team know how to play the game" or "did the enemy counter pick my otp laner" your anger seems to be mostly directed at the mage supports who can sometimes have the ability to come out of lane with roughly the same build as they would in mid but honestly, despite the fact that I didn't watch all of the games at world's I don't remember seeing a single mage support as where I definitely saw a lot of Nautilus, so maybe, just maybe your pov is ABSURDLY biased?

>You talk a lot about "how support was meant to be".... correct me if I'm wrong but I don't believe you own league of legends? I mean you don't make the updates you don't create new champions... Essentially the only thing you do for this game from the looks of it is come here and try to tell people what's what from your own beliefs.

You are in some serious denial... It has nothing to do with my beliefs but absolute facts.

>But regardless I don't SEE anywhere that defines what a support SHOULD be?

That's because you don't think, are inexperienced and lack basic game knowledge. I literally explained to you what defines what supports are supposed to be and yet you act like you didn't even read it (because you probably didn't). It makes perfect sense.

It's not riot that invented the support role and it's definition but the players, more specifically, the professional players. Instead of sharing the gold on the map between 5 players, they decided that it's much better to share it between 4 players and have that one player play a utility champion that is useful even without gold so the team gets overall stronger without having a useless member on the team. It's a perfect strategy, the earliest for of funnel in fact. That gave birth to the support role that exists in other moba games too, like dota 2 for the exact same reason. What the players INVENTED it for is what it is supposed to be. That is what defines it. It was the players anyway that defined the current role meta (1 top, 1 jungle, 1 mid and 2 bot and what kind of champions go to those roles), not riot.

>So if riot wanted supports to be able to actually have a build then who are you to stop them?

You are right about that. If riot want to redefine a role then they are absolutely in a position to do it. It's their game and they have the power. That doesn't mean they SHOULD do it.

>You seem extremely biased into hating the support role

Nothing points to me hating the support role. Absolutely nothing. That's a just a baseless assumption made by you because you want to look like a victim. I'm literally trying to reinforce what it means to be a support unlike you.

>but yet I bet a good support is the exact reason you feel good when you play the game and think you're "carrying" and get a lot of kills, but how many kills less would you be if the support didn't set them up for you through the use of vision and well timed shields/cc.

Sometimes yes but more often it's the support that gets carried because they are mostly clueless about the game. I can set up my own kills as a mid laner but i do know when the support helped. However, none of this has anything to do with the topic and is just here because you can't figure out an actual counter point so you just try to attack me personally.

>Besides it is extremely ignorant to say that a role that you don't like should be blatantly deprived of income.

It's ignorant to say they shouldn't be. And i still don't hate the role. The reason why they should be deprived of income is listed above and i'm not going to repeat myself.

>What about solo queue for someone who likes playing support? Are they just supposed to be thousands of gold behind because according to you they should "give their resources to others." Really? I should give resources to my random mid yasuo who is 0/6? Or my jungler who has attempted to tower the enemies in my lane and died 3-4 times?

Yes, you should. One other good reason is that they benefit from gold way more than you do. You are already useful without gold while someone like yasuo isn't. Giving him the gold is going to benefit your team way more than taking the gold on a support.

> The reason supports NEED to have an income that is roughly similar to a laner is so that the whole game isn't down to "does this other player on my team know how to play the game" or "did the enemy counter pick my otp laner"

That's not the reason why laners need gold... Laners need gold to get items so they can be useful in the way they are meant to be useful. You know, carries deal more damage and tanks can take more damage and split pushers can split push better etc. Supports don't need gold to be good at supporting. And gold doesn't make up for the lack of skill. If we look at this from a balance perspective, we have to assume everyone in the match is around the same skill level, which means you taking the gold instead of your ally yasuo or something is not going to help your team because overall you aren't any better at the game than he is and since he is playing a champion that benefits more from the gold than you do, he should get it. You taking a gold from a yasuo as a braum or some shit like that isn't going to be a good thing for your team. That's an undeniable fact.

> your anger

What anger? Stating facts doesn't make me angry. You are attacking me personally again because you don't have any valid arguments.

> seems to be mostly directed at the mage supports who can sometimes have the ability to come out of lane with roughly the same build as they would in mid but honestly, despite the fact that I didn't watch all of the games at world's I don't remember seeing a single mage support as where I definitely saw a lot of Nautilus, so maybe, just maybe your pov is ABSURDLY biased?

Or your pov is ABSURDLY ignorant. First of all, {{champion:79}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:99}} were played as mage supports at worlds and i didn't count champions like {{champion:43}} as a mage support in this case because she is at least meant to be a support, even though she is still working like a mage support.

Secondly, even if they aren't picked at worlds, they can still be extremely viable. Pros value strong peel or engage options on supports over damage supports because it gives them more tools to work around. Also kinda supports my point about what supports are supposed to be, no pun intended. But back to the point. Most people don't play pro scene so it matters more what we see in places like soloq and how powerful things are there because that's what most people can experience. Mage supports are strong in soloq so trying to use pro scene as a way to imply that they aren't strong is not a valid method of doing so.

Thirdly, do not hate mage supports. I just don't like them because a) they don't offer anything that an actual champion meant to be a support does and b) they are only viable due to high gold income that supports have gotten over the years. Currently they are way more tolerable than last season because they lack the items to be overly oppressive and they lost the bonus damage proc from spell thief. Now they can get their 2 core items but not much more than that which is a good thing.
Lol engage tanks are thriving because they build like supports. Not like brands and zyras that's just build full damage even though they are a "support"

Engage supports are thriving because their items cost 2200-2300 gold. 

You have to be a troll.
I litteral just sad that... enchanter items are the same cost as support tank items. You dont need damage as a support
I just think she should have her range nerfed on both AA and Q. But other than that shes okay imo.

> [{quoted}](name=iMidg3t,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GoAkMA7P,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-11-26T18:44:21.411+0000)
>
> I just think she should have her range nerfed on both AA and Q. But other than that shes okay imo.

Yeah it's kinda ridiculous cause she pretty quickly matches Caitlyn's range, and then surpasses it.
Caitlyn does significantly more DPS and can scales with AS. Senna does not.

> [{quoted}](name=Ooduwa,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GoAkMA7P,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2019-11-28T00:14:47.910+0000)
>
> Caitlyn does significantly more DPS and can scales with AS. Senna does not.

Senna's burst is pretty big, with that second shot. Caitlyn's DPS isn't actually that great, it only peaks with Headshot, Net, or Trap use. 

It's just ridiculous that she outranges the "sniper" of league quickly, at least Tristana's gotta wait until the game's basically over to outscale her.

I think the biggest things that could reasonabley nerf her down are 
1. Nerf the amount her q self heals
2. Nerf ult base damage and make it so that you NEED to build ad for it to hit hard
As long as she doesn't get one of those ridiculous dash/blinks Riot is so fond of excessively handing out to new champions, I'm sort of fine with it.

this is coming from the same idiots at riot that think ekko is balanced. if he was balanced, then why is he the most banned jungler right now? is he even being looked at? the fact that he's supposed to be this squishy assassin, but can literally tank a nuclear blast is ridiculous.

> [{quoted}](name=RacoonHunter,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GoAkMA7P,comment-id=001b,timestamp=2019-11-27T04:13:59.628+0000)
>
> this is coming from the same idiots at riot that think ekko is balanced. if he was balanced, then why is he the most banned jungler right now? is he even being looked at? the fact that he's supposed to be this squishy assassin, but can literally tank a nuclear blast is ridiculous.

He was balanced up until Riot gave him an unnecessary buff to shoehorn him into the Worlds meta and possibly to sell his legendary -tinfoil hat off-

The W buff needs to be reverted imo

What's worrying me is her ADC win and pick rate go UP the higher elo you check. 


Supportwise she needs small nerfs, but adc wise she needs to be gutted. IDK, make it sure she can't CS I guess. Give her innate penalties for csing sounds like an idea
as much as i hate to say it (because i really like this champ) but if a new champ has a positive winrate like 2 days after the release, you know the champ is super broken.

How should they nerf her? She hasn't been out long enough to figure out how to tune her. 

Everyone say's she has an 'overloaded kit' but Its not like she has 9 effects on each ability.  They are each fairly simple.  Only her passive is complicated, and thats because it defines how she plays, like jhin.   A few positives, a few negatives.   Her E duration could be hit a bit, maybe her passive could be 25 stacks instead of 20?

I personally would reduce her base range(could do a kindred and make the first stack or so grant more range), remove the stealth mechanic on allies. Just make them the thrall things instead of making them invis. Also possibly cut her self healing. Kinda annoying when she quickly heals herself and allies for 100+ on top of being a carry like champ.
My rudimentary analysis is that Senna needs to either lose some utility or lose some damage.  She has too much of both and is viable in too many roles.
Riot doesn't care and she just got a skin so Riot EXTRA doesn't care.

Every champ starts with an alt skin.

And it's a tough call to "fix her" because her support performance is fine. Only as adc is she pushing suspicious numbers. That's because of about a 15% increased income, and the fact she has a nearly  16% pick rate with Pyke, who supplements her gold and gets her early {{item:3031}} {{item:3147}} .

Also, Riot is technically on vacation until January.

I spammed senna for the first 2 weeks of release and racked up about 75k mastery on her. Here are my thoughts on her:

-She is way too safe for a champion that scales infinitely. You should be able to shut her down early to halt her scaling in its tracks, but with the combination of her AoE CC, camoflouging shroud, and ridiculous range, you can't do that.

-Other champions that scale very hard (Vayne, Kog, Twitch) have extremely short range and punishable early games to offer big windows to shut them down. Why doesn't Senna have that too?

-Her Q being able to target literally everything except thin air will need to go. Senna can use Piercing Darkness on fruits in the jungle, on wards, towers, etc, for a free heal that can save her in too many situations. It's also pretty cancer when she snipes you by placing a ward and Q'ing through it when you thought you were out of range. Maybe change it so Senna can only q through ally champions, minions, and maybe towers.

-Her W is pretty much a mini Varus ult. The root is pretty long with a generous hitbox, and for a peel/cc ability it does a damn good bit of damage. The one or two seconds you have before you're cc'ed usually isn't enough unless you're playing Pyke or Yuumi. Perhaps lower the damage, change it so it detonates instantly but only hits one person, like an ahri charm almost. It feels terrible to have your ally get hit by Last Embrace, and then you're dead too because you couldn't get away from them in time. (It's almost like playing against zilean.)

-I really do have a problem with her E. It's a strange ability, but one that will be completely busted in highly coordinated play. What's not to love? You don't know who's coming at you, the 15/0 Kha'Zix or the 2/6 Draven. While this ability does SOUND cool, it's extremely frustrating to play against. Why does it make you unselectable? It's like an AoE Vlad pool that speeds you up instead of slow you down, that also hides your identity. 

If Rito don't do something this patch, just wait until Senna is inevitably picked in pro play. She'll see her nerfs soon enough then.

Too safe yet she averages 1.6 more deaths than any meta support, and 2 more deaths than any ADC.

2) She does. Just by different champions.

3) Because lining up Q to use it doesn't require immense micro play.

4) It also moves slow  has a delayed effect, and is extremely avoidable.
